title: Open Source Collage
description: Easily the best student organization out there.

title: PacificSTEM
description: PacificSTEM is a 501(c) non-profit organization dedicated to the mission of making STEM more accessible to students and families on the West Coast. Through our STEMLearning program, we empower elementary and middle school students to discover their passions in STEM and provide them with resources to help them learn valuable technical skills in different STEM fields. We also host a yearly March Event, inviting professionals to speak and inspire young students to pursue STEM in the future. PacificSTEM is run by high school student volunteers, who are given the opportunity to undertake projects involving community engagement, outreach, professional development, and furthering STEM education.

title: InterSTEM
description: InterSTEM is a non-profit organization that hopes to raise awareness about the relevance of STEM-related topics to the world. Functioning mainly online, this platform offers a tutoring service for students, updates readers about current news in STEM through articles and blog posts, and plans collaborative projects between high school and elementary students. Through the integration of science, technology, engineering, and mathematics, InterSTEM provides students of all backgrounds the opportunity to explore and dive deeper into the world of STEM.

title: Interverse
description: Interverse Educational Outreach is a 501(c)(3) high school student-run nonprofit organization dedicated to breaking language barriers and connecting people around the world by teaching English as a second language online through two primary components: one-on-one conversations and original educational resources. With our target audience mainly being students from elementary school to the collegiate level, we strive to empower and provide resources for international students to jumpstart their lives and careers in English-speaking countries.

title: Irvine Coding Club
description: In 2020, Irvine Coding Club (ICC) was founded as a school CS club (at Rancho SJ). ICC was created as a student run community service organization for CS enthusiasts. Soon, ICC grew to a non-profit organization in Californa covering topics beyond CS, including math, robotics, art, debate, writing and more. In the future, the ICC plans to create more courses and lectures in order to further benefit the community, as well as hosting workshops and tournaments to inspire more students to take part in their academics while having fun.

title: OC Biology
description: Our mission is to provide all types of students with an environment where they can dive deeper into the field of biology and give them an opportunity to explore hands-on activities. We aim to provide a platform for students to showcase their passion for biology, such as through the form of mentorship, competitions, and school activities.

title: Irvine LIGHTS
description: We are a 501(c)(3) organization aiming to empower the next generation of leaders with essential STEAM skills thorugh interactive activities.

title: Hearts to Heroes
description: Hearts to Heroes provides volunteers with a multitude of opportunities including supply and item donations, care packages, and PPE in order to give back to society’s essential workers. Through involvement in Hearts to Heroes, volunteers develop adaptive leadership and effective communication skills that channel into community outreach efforts.

title: irvineSTEMsesh
description: irvineSTEMsesh is a resource for young learners to explore new ways to learn about STEM concepts. We focus on modern sciences and innovations such as CRISPR, Gene Editing, etc. All our activities cover all aspects of STEM, making it the perfect too for anyone intrested in the science.

title: Asian Youth Act
description: AYA is a non-partisan organization constructed to be an open-minded space where we choose to seek empathy and understanding. AYA empowers Asian students from all over the world to not only be proactive and informed world citizens, but to inspire change in all-generations of the Asian community by providing conversation-starting resources.

title: ObjectiveCode
description: ObjectiveCode is a nonprofit organization focused on cultivating the minds of the incoming generation by teaching code to elementary-high schoolers, sparking passion, and influencing the bright minds of the future to change the world through technology and code.

title: Beyond The Five
description: Beyond The Five is an online platform and community that provides free instruction in AP®️, SAT/ACT, and college level classes. 100% of our students pass their AP®️ exams. Registration for the 2020-21 school year is now open!

title: Dear Asian Youth
description: Dear Asian Youth is a youth-led, global organization that promotes intersectional activism, solidarity with other marginalized communities, and equality and equity. Through our digital platform, grassroots organizing, and community-based advocacy, we strive to showcase diversity in the Asian community as well as accurate and holistic representation.

title: Helyx Initiative
description: The Helyx Initiative is an international bioinformatics organization whose mission is to teach biology, math, and computer science as a unified whole.

title: Korean American Young Leaders
description: Korean American Young Leaders (KAYL) provide unique opportunities to promote social justice for Korean Americans and empower Asian-American students through leadership development and community service!

title: Writer's Ink
description: Writer's Ink is a non-profit organization solely run by high school volunteers. Since our early beginnings in 2014, our goal has been to redefine creative writing and English literacy education.

title: United Under Arts
description: United Under Arts is a global student-led nonprofit organization dedicated to providing opportunities to learn about and experience the arts to all, particularly underserved populations such as children and the elderly around the world. We run free arts-based events such as concerts, recitals, workshops, and tutoring to bring joy and meaning to all and facilitate connections across all ages and backgrounds.

title: Medixly
description: Medixly is a startup aiming to provide healthcare innovation for patients through an application. Through the collaboration of the teams, each contributing towards the development of the projects we work on, the startup presents various software on the application to assist patients with specific areas of their health.
